storyInfo: Pinecone receives a letter from her dad, which writes of the anxious and earnest hopes of a father and worker.

attributes.content: 7:00 A.M. \ Sunny, clear
Rhodes Island Dormitories
Mina? Mina? You up?
Nnuuh...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Shaky bedframeâ€”bad...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Buh! You're already back, Kafka?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Just landed. Moseyed on down to you afore anything else... Oh, aaand I got a letter for you. From your dad.
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: Ooh, thanks!
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You only got back yourself dead of night, didn'tcha?
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: Been takin' more stuff on these days...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You hit snooze, then. I got a Logistics Dep to swing by.
attributes.name: Kafka

attributes.content: Doing well, Mina?
Your mom wanted Kafka to run you some clothes, but I intervened. Figured your friend was plenty busy enough back here in Columbia, seemed it'd inconvenience her.
How's your new job? They call it Rhodes Island? Kafka says you get along just swell with your coworkers.
If both her and the old Simon Co. head are working there, I bet it must be rock solid.
8:00 A.M. \ Sunny, clear
Rhodes Island Engineering Department Hallway
...Bridge's facade repairs are basically done. Just a little testing an' work's wrapped up all tidy. Iâ€”I'll get to it in a bit.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Heck, you're done two whole days ahead of schedule.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Best not forget to inspect the bridge this afternoon, Mr. Jeff.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: It's fine, when have you ever messed up on the job? I'm a proud mentor here.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Say, Pinecone, were you in a hurry to get out this morning?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Uh... don't think so.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Look at your socks. One's a stocking and the other's ankle-high. Not to mention the color clash.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Oh, shoot!
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Looks like you got muddled again. Maybe that afternoon inspection really is called for.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Uh, socks are socks, work's work...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You don't slip up at work either, but last week, um, you had your gloves in the microwave like they were a loaf of bread.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Yeah, you sure did! And Closure chewed you out hard for that.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Look, I was half-asleep by that point, okay?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Ahem... Okay, Pinecone, brass tacks. Here's the Engineering itinerary for today. Take it and get to work.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: I'll see you cafeteria-side at noon, Pinecone! Don't forget lunch this time!
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Mm-hm, got it.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: How long's she been here at Rhodes now?
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Clocking in close to a year. I was the one taking her through sign-on the day she reported in.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Registered her info, checked in at the dorms, and gave a tour of the landship. She was both curious and nervous the whole way. Didn't ask much, though, kept shy.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: But the very last step, the simplest one, that was a real wringer.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: The Engineering Operator contract's only a couple pages, right? She went through at least seven, eight times, checked over every single line with an HR op for any breach of contract clauses that might be lurking.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: HR was convinced she was straight-up a spy from some other firm...
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: And she was way too serious about work while she was new. Enough to make even Closure not wanna assign anything to her.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Less serious, and more terrified of messing up. She took everything real carefully. I hear it's 'cause of some stuff she went through in Columbia, Kafka mentioned it once.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: I remember nobody was willing to even crack a joke in front of her. Look at her now, though, firing your goofs right back at you.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Hahahahahâ€”sorry, Jeff, I just can't help it.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator B

attributes.content: Quit giggling... we're on the clock.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Your dad's recovering just fine. The whole project's been put on hold, though, and even the office shuttered. I asked around, and heard it was an investor that went belly-up. Simon Co.?
I'd been stuck at home for half a year now, no new job to speak of. Really hanging over me, but what can you do?

That's just the line of work we're in. Doesn't matter if you're in the right, clashing with the site owner is a big no-no. People think you'll rock the boat. Not to mention Columbia's got construction workers to spare.

Thank heavens for all the money you've been sending home... It's all my fault for being so useless, Mina, I know I'm a burden on you. Dashing all over the place with Rhodes Island can't be easy going either.
1:00 P.M. \ Sunny, clear
Rhodes Island Convalescent Garden
Thank you for taking the time today, Pinecone.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I found all these ruptured floor tiles yesterday while inspecting the greenhouse. Water's seeped all unevenly through the walls too.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Sprinklers are working alright?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Mm-hm, PRTS upgraded them just last month.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Uh-huh... floor got a case of overworn moisture proofing...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Will it be hard to fix?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Add extra dried charcoal to each part's proofing, re-lay the proofing for the damaged floor tiles, and that should do it.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Not much hassle, but... it'll take a li'l bit. Just leave this to me.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Phewâ€”this should be good...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: (Unghâ€”shoulders are killing me...)
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You've been at this for five hours straight, I can't thank you enough! I got you some flower cookiesâ€”take them, I insist.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Let me see you out.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: You got so many flowers here. Didn't even notice till now.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: We barely ever see you in the Convalescent Garden! How about I give you the tour? It's the perfect opportunity.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We cultivate a lot of rare flora here. Miss Lena says you could compare it to an entire small-scale botanical garden.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: That's some mighty fine work...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I loved reading things like The Nomadic City Gazetteer, back in BolÃ­var.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: They wrote about how all the big cities had gardens and nature museums, and how they'd hold regular botanical expos, and that they'd assemble all kinds of rare plant life for people to admire.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: And I wanted to go and see those places for myself, so badly.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Did ya ever go, then?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I never did. Right after I left home, I met Miss Lena, and then I came to Rhodes Island with her.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: These are summer wisterias, these are iridescent hydrangeas...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: These are coralblack willows... These are skeleton flowers, a very mysterious kind. They're native to the Higashi mountains.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: You can see how they're pink right now, right? But when they get wet in the rain, they slowly turn translucent!
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: They do?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Mm-hm, it gave me such a shock the first time I saw it. Do you want to see, Pinecone? I could sprinkle a little water...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Uhâ€”I'm good, I'm good.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: These are fire crotons... The ones in the pots over there are pinetails, which flower for just one short week.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Oh wilderness, wilderness, runnin' for the skyâ™ª
Oh city home, city home, my palms they hold you rightâ™ª
Machines do roll, do roll with careâ™ª
Say don't roll over them grassreed hairsâ™ª
They'll move to city home, come some right timeâ™ª
They'll live with us, come some right timeâ™ª
Hmm, hmmâ€”uh, sorry 'bout that...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: No, that was wonderful! What's that song called?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Dad taught me it, um... it's just those lines, no name, really.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I used to... put in shifts with my dad at the site, but work was always on. Barely got to talk the whole day.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: So after we clocked out, he'd walk me home real relaxed-like. We sung that song all the time, to shake the day off.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Sing it the whole way, and suddenly you're not so tired anymore.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Did you help build a lot of new cities, while you were in Columbia?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: The lyrics talked about taking the plants home, so you must've had gardens and nature museums, right? So were there really flower expos?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Nnuuh...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Iâ€”I don't know... Dad came up with the words himself...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: All I really remember's the wilderness... A whole lotta heavy machinery driving out into the barrens, bringin' along all the workers and materials together.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Construction's awful loud, even scarin' off all the fowlbeasts living nearby. Nothin' but dust, all across the land and sky... 'n then layer after layer of buildings rising on up, fast as fast goes.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Sometimes the foreman'd tell us what the buildings were for. Office block, lab, observatory... 'n all together they'd form a city.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Um... but it wasn't like we could imagine how it'd pan out after folks moved in.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Once one project gets wrapped up, the machines all moved us off to a new patch of wild... Some folk who fell ill and couldn't work anymore got left where they were...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Altogether, I guess, um... we only ever saw the city blueprints, and the materials to build 'em, never the actual city.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Oh, that's far enough. If the seepage ain't sorted out, come get me anytime.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: But surprise! Your dad's found new work!

Remember Uncle Peter? He's an old work buddy of mine, and now he's a foreman. Does right by his friends too, I tell you! Called me in to the site. Good thing I kept covering his shifts all those years ago!

We're working on a small-scale nomadic city right now. I hear it's going to be used to temporarily settle people forced to migrate. It's no real big place, but functional enough, and welfare facilities are all well accounted for.
Peter says they're anticipating this city to work like a burdenbeast, doing runs through the wilds between big places like Trimounts, taking in anyone without a homeland anymore.
And it's all up to us to see to it that this burdenbeast gallops smooth!

Never thought Peter was foreman material, to be honest. The way he talks has grown just as much too. But he sure tells it like it is. There's still a hell of a lot of meaning in us building these hulking new cities.
That's our lot as frontier workers. The men don't matter so much, but the things we do matter like nothing else.
Rhodes Island disused training grounds
Umm... is she not here yet?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Whoofâ€”
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Late, sorry about that.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Iâ€”It's fine, I just got here from the Convalescent Garden.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You've never been skateboarding, yeah? I copied a few photos from when I won 'Legs on Wings.' Check it, that's the skatepark behind me there.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I canâ€”give it a shot.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I owe you, Pinecone. You're doing me a solid.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It's fine. Closure says the landship needs more recreational facilities to help us all destress... but it might be kinda cramped indoors...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: A buffer zone, some grind rails, a quarter-pipe, a half-pipe, a bowl, and a wave... That's all you need to kick it. Watch me if you don't believe.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Lucky it's sloped right here. Hmmm... if we buff out the floor a little, then install a bar down here beside the...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: For sure. You do that, I can finally pull off that nosegrind. Sweet!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: What was, um, the 'Legs on Wings' thing you...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: It was this trick skateboarding competition a couple blocks got together to hold. Nothing big-time, but crazy professional. Champion's prize was a high-grade, custom-made board... yeah, see what I'm riding right now? This is one of them bad boys.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: They quit holding it even before I started getting treated at Rhodes, though.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Whâ€”Why?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Neighborhood was old bones, government turned it over to a megacorp to turn into a commercial sector. Said they were gonna build this business complex over the park we hung out at.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Whoops, I meant 'commercial sector.' All they did was the same shady business once they landed...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But in a city as big as Trimounts, skating, graffiti, it's stuff they only let you do in a designated area... a tiny little corner.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Oh. But isn't it meant to be... real neat stuff?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Neat's not a word to them, y'know? Freedom, risk... the bigshots don't like that stuff.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: They need order, doesn't matter if it's good or bad. 'Street culture's' just a dirty word to those guys.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I didn't... know that about cities...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Pshh... who cares, we got the last laugh. Sprayed dumb faces all over their construction site warnings...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Mr. Jeff, what're you doin' here...? Diâ€”Did somethin' turn up with the bridge maintenance?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: That's been checked and green-lighted. But I'm sorry, we're probably gonna need to call a halt to your skatepark project.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Um. We already notified Closure about it beforehand.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Here's the thing, Pinecone. This training grounds was pegged for specialist combat drilling in the future. They're gonna overhaul the whole space to simulate battle environments.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Closure had to put it on the backburner, but now...
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Mr. Jeff, to be honest...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Aw, forget it, Pinecone. Skateboarding's the freest art anyway. What kinda Champion Legs on Wings would I be if I let a park tie me down?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But if people complain to Logistics about how 'somebody's making a racket skating in the halls,' that's not my problem, yeah?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: We taking these poles and stuff down now then?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Good thing you'd only just started. Should be a cinch to return a place this small to the way it was.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Um, uh, doâ€”don't take it down for now!
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Mr. Jeff, the, umâ€”follow-up training ground refurb, could youâ€”could you let me be in charge of that?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: To be honest, the pipes and bowls and wave ramps you need for trick skateboarding seem real close to how the terrain gets rugged in the countryside...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: You think there's the possibility, uh, the stunt track could be... integrated with the development of the training grounds?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Could you let me be in charge? Iâ€”I want Operator Aciddrop and the rest... to have a place they can skate freely.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: If I recall correctly, this is the first time you're proactively applying for a role, after all your time here at Rhodes.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: The refurb's a big project, though. If you want to blend it with a skatepark, I can't imagine it'll be all that easy. You'll need to learn a whole lot of things...
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Iâ€”I can give it my best shot.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Then you find Closure soon, and apply. I can be there to vouch for you.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Um... huh? Really? Thanks a dozen, Mr. Jeff!
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Alright, I'll see you then.
attributes.name: Engineering Operator A

attributes.content: Why'd you hafta go and sign up for all that extra work? I'm feeling beat just thinking about it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Uh, um, I don't really know either. I just felt, I should try as hard as I could...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Rhodes Island'sâ€”like a little city of its own, I s'pose... and cities ought to be real grand.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Grand? Now that's a loaded word.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Mm. Billboards on all the sites in Columbia kept using itâ€”'build grand new cities, beautify Columbia's badlands.'
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: I asked my dad, once, just what aâ€”a grand city was.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Though to be honest, he didn't know either. Still, I reckon it should be somewhere with everything... with botanical gardens and nature museums, regular plant life expos where everyone can come see the pretty flowers...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: And giant libraries you can read in, no matter who you are.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: And streets free for everyone to skate on, and walls so they can graffiti as much as they like...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Not to be a wet blanket, but every city in Columbia's gonna disappoint you with those standards.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: They use slogans to dupe the workers, and ideals to dupe the youth. That's Columbia.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Er, um... you're right about that.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: But, well, but my dad told me, Columbia's got more pioneer workers than you can count. Probably hardly anyone reckons we matter, but the things we do have gotta matter a whole lot.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Uh. Us, ourselves, we ought to believe in that.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: He was real sick before. It took a lot before he got better. But recently he found his way back to work. Said he was building a grand new city too.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: So, I just think it's right I keep at it too...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: If nothing we built before amounted to any kind of grand city, then at least starting now, I can make Rhodes Island a better place.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Um. So first, we gotta get you somewhere you can skate freely.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Rad... I've got your back on this one!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: And also, you take part in our 'Legs on Wings' competition too! In light of your outstanding contributions to the competition venue, we can seed you for the semifinals.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Mm... muh?
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Well, we got a place now, so why not revive 'Legs on Wings' here while we're at it? You dig it, right? I know you do!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (It'll be easy to win over the Doc and Amiya anyways.)
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Umm, inâ€”in that case, I'll go apply with Closure at Engineering tomorrow... so we can get your venue set up soon as we can.
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Dormitories
Bridge, greenhouse, stunt park... That's everything for today, finally. Tomorrow, I gotta...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: ...It's some kinda late now. Mmm, I'm feelin' sleepy...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Oh, forgot about fixin' the loose bedframe. *yawn*â€”t'mmmorrow...
attributes.name: Pinecone

attributes.content: Oh wilderness, wilderness, runnin' for the skyâ™ª
Oh city home, city home, my palms they hold you rightâ™ª
Machines do roll, do roll with careâ™ª
Say don't roll over them grassreed hairsâ™ª
They'll move to city home, come some right timeâ™ª
They'll live with us, come some right timeâ™ª
I'm on my way out to work now. Didn't think I'd have so much to write about. Didn't even get to anything important.
So I'll wrap this up quick, Mina. Work hard, and rest hard too. Take care of yourself.
